column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: June 3 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Wednesday:

column4: HBO mulls moving 'Veep' production from Maryland over taxes
column5: Time Warner Inc unit HBO is considering moving film production of the Emmy award-winning show "Veep" to California from Maryland for better tax incentives  a spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: HBO mulls moving 'Veep' production from Maryland over taxes
column5: June 3 Time Warner Inc unit HBO is considering moving film production of the Emmy award-winning show "Veep" to California from Maryland for better tax incentives  a spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: Toyota to explore Ford's SDL in-car smartphone app interface
column5: Toyota Motor Corp said it reached an agreement with Ford Motor to explore collaboration for the implementation of Ford's SmartDeviceLink (SDL) technology in future Toyota and Lexus vehicles.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota to explore Ford's SDL in-car smartphone app interface
column5: June 3 Toyota Motor Corp said it reached an agreement with Ford Motor to explore collaboration for the implementation of Ford's SmartDeviceLink (SDL) technology in future Toyota and Lexus vehicles.

column4: Ford says Toyota studying its SDL in-car smartphone app interface
column5: June 3 Ford Motor Co said Toyota Motor Corp is studying the open-source version of Ford AppLink  called SmartDeviceLink (SDL)  to integrate smartphone apps into its vehicles in future.

column4: Australia new vehicle sales level off in May-VFACTS
column5: SYDNEY  June 3 Sales of new vehicles in Australia dipped slightly in May compared to the same month a year ago  though there was no sign of any let up in consumers' love affair with sports utilities.     The Australian Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries' VFACTS report on Wednesday showed sales fell 1.3 percent in May as the month had one less selling day than May last year.     Sales of 93 327 were up 14.3 percent on April  which is typically a quieter month for activity.     S

column4: Top UK shares rise despite subdued data
column5: LONDON  June 3 Britain's top equity index slightly underperformed its euro zone peers on Wednesday as a survey of the dominant services sector came in sharply below forecasts.

column4: Top UK shares underperform Europe after subdued data
column5: LONDON  June 3 Britain's top equity index underperformed its eurozone peers on Wednesday after a services-sector survey came in sharply below forecasts  partly offsetting a rebound in confidence across Europe on hopes of a Greek deal.

column4: Weaker property and utility stocks weigh on Britain's FTSE
column5: LONDON  June 3 Britain's top equity index made little progress on Wednesday as a rise in bond yields hit utility and property shares  whose typically high debt levels make them particularly vulnerable to credit market jitters.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. steel firms file complaint over cheaper imports
column5: CHICAGO/WASHINGTON  June 3 U.S. steel companies on Wednesday filed a complaint with the U.S. government over cheaper imports of corrosion-resistant steel from China  India  Italy  South Korea and Taiwan  kicking off a process that could end in import duties.

column4: U.S. steel companies file complaint about imports of corrosion-resistant steel
column5: WASHINGTON  June 3 U.S. steel companies on Wednesday filed a complaint about imports of corrosion-resistant steel from China  India  Italy  South Korea and Taiwan  starting a process that could end in import duties.

column4: Wal-Mart relaxing dress code in bid to address worker concerns
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said it was relaxing its dress code and raising the temperature at its stores as part of an effort to improve working conditions at its 4 555 U.S. locations.

column4: Wal-Mart relaxing dress code in bid to address worker concerns
column5: June 3 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it was relaxing its dress code and raising the temperature at its stores as part of an effort to improve working conditions at its 4 555 U.S. locations.

column4: Woori Bank marketing AT1 dollar bonds at 5% yield
column5: HONG KONG  June 3 (IFR) - South Korean lender Woori Bank  is marketing its first US dollar issue of Additional Tier 1 capital securities at a yield of around 5%.
